image.altText: Israeli army chief speaking at a lectern in uniform

items.synopsis: While refraining from calling it a ground invasion, the Israel Defence Forces says a number of troops are holding ground in the northern part of the Gaza Strip.

title.children: Israel says troops are holding ground in Gaza in 'next phase' of the war

image.altText: A screenshot from body camera footage showing a gun pointed down a road as a car approaches.

items.synopsis: A grim information war is raging parallel to the physical violence in Israel and Gaza, and while this form of warfare is as old as war itself, with help from social media it's now happening in real-time on a massive scale.

title.children: Inside the online war where cartoon unicorns and Telegram channels are used by Israel and Hamas

items.synopsis: Australians with terminal illnesses are being left in limbo as state governments and the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) battle over who should fund their disability supports.

title.children: Nurses caught in a gap between the NDIS and the health system they served for decades

image.altText: Sam Kane runs from the field after being handed a yellow card in the Rugby World Cup final.

items.synopsis: Down to 14 players, the All Blacks score the first try of the tournament decider as they cut back the Springboks' lead in Paris. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: All Blacks fight back after being dealt massive blow in Rugby World Cup final

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Mark Tele'a is a super star! The maul defence is superb from the Springboks, but eventually they give away the penalty. The All Blacks spin the ball left to centre field, the Boks defence is a green wall - impenetrable. Until the cross big pass out wide from Jordie Barrett to Mark Tele'a. He beat one, two, three tacklers and then scooped the ball along the ground to Beauden Barrett, who dived over in the corner! Richie Mo'unga misses the conversion, the difference is just a point, 11-12.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 58'  Try New Zealand!

children.content: Mark Tele'a is a super star!
The maul defence is superb from the Springboks, but eventually they give away the penalty.
The All Blacks spin the ball left to centre field, the Boks defence is a green wall - impenetrable.
Until the cross big pass out wide from Jordie Barrett to Mark Tele'a.
He beat one, two, three tacklers and then scooped the ball along the ground to Beauden Barrett, who dived over in the corner!
Richie Mo'unga misses the conversion, the difference is just a point, 11-12.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Brilliant from Richie Mo'unga! He skipped away from one tackle, then ran away from Damian de Allende before clipping the ball back inside to Aaron Smith. It's a wonderful try - but hang on... Ardie Savea knocked the ball on at the lineout! There is a penalty coming the All Blacks way instead for interference in the air by the Boks. The crowd are incensed by another (entirely correct, it must be said) that's gone against the All Blacks.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 54' Try All Blacks! NO DISALLOWED!

children.content: He skipped away from one tackle, then ran away from Damian de Allende before clipping the ball back inside to Aaron Smith.
It's a wonderful try - but hang on...
Ardie Savea knocked the ball on at the lineout!
There is a penalty coming the All Blacks way instead for interference in the air by the Boks.
The crowd are incensed by another (entirely correct, it must be said) that's gone against the All Blacks.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: And, given the red card to Sam Cane, it's hard to see how Siya Kolisi can come back! A head-on-head contact, an upright tackle and hard contact to the head. Is there a bit of a dip though? Is there a slight change of direction? It was an upright tackle though and Kolisi will be sweating on this. Another massive moment in the game.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 46' Siya Kolisi sent to the sin bin!

children.content: And, given the red card to Sam Cane, it's hard to see how Siya Kolisi can come back!
A head-on-head contact, an upright tackle and hard contact to the head.
Is there a bit of a dip though? Is there a slight change of direction? It was an upright tackle though and Kolisi will be sweating on this.
Another massive moment in the game.

image.altText: Bob Carr and Helena Carr look toward the camera while walking on a street at night

items.synopsis: Helena Carr — the long-time wife of former New South Wales premier and foreign minister Bob Carr – has been declared brain dead from an aneurysm during an overseas trip.

title.children: Former NSW premier and foreign minister Bob Carr's wife Helena dies overseas

image.altText: An illustration showing a hand putting a slip of paper into a ballot box, with an Indigenous artwork as a background.

items.synopsis: With the Voice to Parliament resoundingly defeated, many people – including legal experts – have been left wondering whether there is any hope of ever again changing Australia’s 123-year-old constitution.

title.children: A kilo of sausages cost 20 cents last time a referendum passed. Will we ever change the constitution again?

image.altText: A collage of old and new images of Taylor Swift performing against a back drop of her original and new 1989 albums

items.synopsis: 1989 (Taylor's Version) is here, revisiting Taylor Swift's incredibly successful turn at pop music. For some, it's the album that turned them into Swifties. For others, 1989 marks her most strategic marketing era.

title.children: As 1989 (Taylor's Version) delivers Taylor Swift another career high, we unpack why it's her most defining era

image.altText: Flames burn from a ventilation shaft above Pike River mine in 2010.

items.synopsis: New Zealand pledged to improve its workplace health and safety record, but 13 years later, Pike River Mine families say "we have learnt absolutely nothing".

title.children: NZ was meant to learn from the Pike River Mine disaster. Then White Island erupted

image.altText: A young girl holding a magazine in hands.

items.synopsis: Picking up unwanted items from the street is becoming a new trend among China's young generation, with city "stooping" groups emerging on social media across the country's major cities.

title.children: Young people in China embrace 'stooping' culture of turning rubbish into treasure

image.altText: A woman wearing a green blazer stands with a serious expression, behind her is a man in a suit

items.synopsis: The health information of 121 patients and the name and phone number of 12,624 SA Health patients were accessed during the breach, South Australia's health minister says.

title.children: Thousands of SA public health patients caught up in data breach of third-party platform

image.altText: A man smiles at a marina.

items.synopsis: Dolphin cruise operator William Pyke knew international tourism figures would not bounce back right away after the pandemic — but he did not think it would take this long.

title.children: Tourism sector takes stock of South Australia's slow post-pandemic international visitor recovery

image.altText: A man wearing a welder's mask works on metal

items.synopsis: The South Australian government has announced funding for housing, firefighting and mobile coverage in the south-east.

title.children: Will government intervention get Travis out of a frosty caravan and into a home?

image.altText: A little penguin stares out of its burrow

items.synopsis: Volunteers have scoured Granite Island to find some encouraging evidence of little penguins maintaining a population that had fallen from more than 1,600 to less than 20.

title.children: Small penguin steps give researchers hope that island colony is recovering

image.altText: Joanne, a woman with short bouffant grey hair wears navy pink stripey polo gazes at seepage by a breached levee, gum trees

items.synopsis: Flood-affected farmers in South Australia's Murraylands are calling for action in repairing broken levees to prevent future disaster.

title.children: Joanne lost her income after her farm was flooded twice when state-owned levees failed. She wants them fixed

image.altText: Woman with hazel eyes and dark hair smiles at camera

items.synopsis: NT Police say they have recovered the human remains on Nourlangie Rock, believed to be missing 35-year-old Jessica Louise Stephens.

title.children: Human remains found at Kakadu National Park, believed to be that of missing woman

image.altText: A man hits a shot during a cricket match

items.synopsis: Australia beats New Zealand by five runs in Dharamshala to move closer to a semifinal place at the cricket World Cup.

title.children: Australia close in on World Cup semifinal after classic win over New Zealand

image.altText: A view of a girl being pulled from a train at a station.

items.synopsis: The 16-year-old dies after being in a coma following an alleged encounter with officers on the Tehran Metro over violating the country's hijab law.

title.children: Iranian teen injured on Tehran Metro while not wearing headscarf dies, state media says

image.altText: A man wearing a navy suit and tie sitting on a leather chair with a small screen in front of him reading Australia

items.synopsis: Australia's ambassador and permanent representative to the United Nations said the resolution did not recognise Hamas as the perpetrator of the October 7 attack on Israel.

title.children: Australia abstains 'with disappointment' from UN resolution on Israel-Hamas truce

image.altText: An view from above showing a neighbourhood on the left it is green with trees on the right it is grey from rubble

items.synopsis: Entire neighbourhoods lie in ruins, particularly in northern Gaza, after nearly three weeks of bombardment. With air strikes continuing, these satellite images provide a glimpse of the devastation.

title.children: Satellite images show parts of Gaza now a wasteland after weeks of heavy bombardment

image.altText: Two men wearing suits standing outside a Melbourne court

items.synopsis: A Neo-Nazi who a judge had just deemed to have good prospects of rehabilitation was filmed doing a Nazi salute as soon as he stepped outside the court.

title.children: Offensive gesture outside court provides first test of Victoria's new ban of the Nazi salute

image.altText: A man carrying a plastic shopping bag walks across rubble and destroyed buildings

items.synopsis: There is a disturbing lack of bipartisanship on the question of the Middle East, which has real world consequences and seems to potentially point to an ugly new direction in domestic politics, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: Comments from Australian leaders about the Middle East point to an ugly new direction for our political future

image.altText: Marine rescue boat cruising in the water

items.synopsis: The wreckage of a helicopter missing since Thursday morning has been found in the New South Wales Hunter region following an extensive land and sea search.

title.children: Missing helicopter wreckage found in NSW Hunter region

image.altText: A man celebrates after scoring a try in a rugby league match

items.synopsis: One try a year is normally a good return for Lindsay Collins, but the Roosters forward was in a scoring mood for Australia in their win over New Zealand in Melbourne.

title.children: Lindsay Collins becomes a try-scoring machine as Kangroos defeat New Zealand

image.altText: A woman in a yellow soccer shirt poses for a selfie with a young supporter.

items.synopsis: Sam Kerr and the Matildas prepare for the challenge of the Philippines in Perth on Sunday, with the superstar revealing why it's taken her so long to return to full health.

title.children: 'Everyone's really ready': Matildas prepare for Philippines as Sam Kerr reveals extent of injury fight

image.altText: A boy cycles past "Lewiston strong" banners in Lewiston, Maine

items.synopsis: US authorities say a man suspected of fatally shooting 18 people and wounding 13 in the north-east state of Maine has been found dead following a 48-hour manhunt.

title.children: Maine mass shooting suspect found dead following 48-hour manhunt

image.altText: Donald Trump in a blue suit and tie outside a courtroom

items.synopsis: The former US president is set to testify on November 6 at his New York civil fraud trial, following three of his children to the witness stand.

title.children: Donald Trump to testify in fraud trial, along with Ivanka, Donald Jr and Eric

image.altText: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken meets with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi.

items.synopsis: The first visit by a Chinese foreign minister to Washington since 2018 may help keep lines of communication open between the two geopolitical rivals.

title.children: Top US and Chinese diplomats pave way for Joe Biden and Xi Jinping summit

image.altText: A woman laying face down in bed, with her hair sprawled over the sheets and her right arm above her head.

items.synopsis: You've tried everything to get some sleep, but nothing's working. Here's what not to do and what works.

title.children: Struggling to fall asleep? Here's what does and doesn't help with insomnia

image.altText: A close up photo of uncooked grains of coloured rice in a white ceramic bowl

items.synopsis: There are more than 40,000 varieties of cultivated rice. If you've ever wondered about the differences between all the colourful rices at the supermarket, here's a rundown.

title.children: Brown, red, black, riceberry: Which is the healthiest type of rice?

image.altText: Young people play basketball in a youth centre in Alice Springs

items.synopsis: Alice Springs leaders are calling for the outback town to be properly resourced ahead of the summer, when crime traditionally surges in the region.

title.children: 'We can't have another summer like we did': Calls for more action to address Alice Springs crime

image.altText: Broken Hill resident and subscriber to the Barrier Truth, Lyn Farquharson with archive photos of the newspaper

items.synopsis: When Broken Hill's Lyn Farquharson got a letter from her local newspaper about a new delivery fee, she was not impressed. She says she and other longtime readers deserve more for their loyalty.

title.children: 'Not everybody can go on a computer': Why this outback newspaper's new delivery fee has angered locals

image.altText: NASA's Hubble Space Telescope captures the dance of interacting galaxies in Arp-Madore 2339-661 (NGC 7733, NGC 7734).

items.synopsis: The cosmic waltz captured by the ultra-powerful telescope took place roughly 500 million light years away from Earth.

title.children: Hubble telescope captures image of 'galactic dance'
